Are you new? Whoever holds the keys, owns the crypto. If you leave your crypto on an exchange, the exchange has complete control over it. This is true for Bitcoin and XRP and everything in between. Coinbase freezing a user’s account isn’t equal to “power to freeze all BTC txns” https:// twitter.com/bitcoin101/sta tus/948602060370522112 …

It’s extremely risky. The golden rule in crypto is “whoever holds the keys owns the crypto.” Exchanges get “hacked” regularly. Over 900,000 Bitcoin have been stolen since 2011. There isn’t much recourse. You’ll basically be told that you should have known better.
